Home > misc > dist > stk_mindist.m

stk_mindist

PURPOSE

STK_MINDIST computes the separation distance of a set of points

SYNOPSIS

This is a script file.

DESCRIPTION 

 STK_MINDIST computes the separation distance of a set of points

 CALL: D = stk_mindist(X)

    computes the separation distance D of X. More precisely, if X is an
    n x d matrix, then

       D = min_{1 <= i < j <= n} norm(X(i,:) - X(j,:)),

    where norm(.) denotes the Euclidean norm in R^d.

 See also: stk_distance_matrix, stk_filldist

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
This function is called by:

0041 %%
0042 % Check that sk_mindist(x) is empty when x has zero lines
0043 
0044 %!test
0045 %! for nc = [0 5 10],
0046 %!   x = zeros(0, nc);
0047 %!   d = stk_mindist(x);
0048 %!   assert(isempty(d));
0049 %! end
0050 
0051 %%
0052 % Check that sk_mindist(x) is empty when x has only one line.
0053 
0054 %!test
0055 %! for nc = [0 5 10],
0056 %!   x = rand(1, nc);
0057 %!   d = stk_mindist(x);
0058 %!   assert(isempty(d));
0059 %! end
0060 
0061 %%
0062 % Check that sk_mindist(x) is 0.0 when x has 0 columns (but at least 2 lines)
0063 
0064 %!test
0065 %! for nr = [2 5 10],
0066 %!   x = zeros(nr, 0);
0067 %!   d = stk_mindist(x);
0068 %!   assert(isequal(d, 0.0));
0069 %! end
0070 
0071 %%
0072 % Random matrices with at least 2 lines and 1 column
0073 
0074 %!test
0075 %!
0076 %! nrep = 20;
0077 %! TOL_REL = 1e-15;
0078 %!
0079 %! for irep = 1:nrep,
0080 %!
0081 %!     n = 2 + floor(rand * 10);
0082 %!     d = 1 + floor(rand * 10);
0083 %!     x = rand(n, d);
0084 %!     z = stk_mindist(x);
0085 %!
0086 %!     assert(isequal(size(d), [1, 1]));
0087 %!     assert(~isnan(d));
0088 %!     assert(~isinf(d));
0089 %!
0090 %!     % check the result
0091 %!     mindist = Inf;
0092 %!     for i = 1:(n-1),
0093 %!         for j = (i+1):n,
0094 %!             mindist = min(mindist, norm(x(i,:) - x(j,:)));
0095 %!         end
0096 %!     end
0097 %!     assert(abs(z - mindist) <= TOL_REL * mindist);
0098 %!
0099 %! end
